zone.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a large area that is different from other areas around it in some way
zone.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: San Francisco and Tokyo are both located in earthquake zones.
The government has set up a special economic zone to promote private enterprise.
zone.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: Civilians were told to leave the danger zone.
Planes were diverted to avoid flying over the war zone.
It’s not advisable to build nuclear reactors in an earthquake zone.

The area has been made a special economic zone.
Small businesses predominated in the enterprise zone.
You can’t leave your car here – it’s a no-parking zone.
The main part of the city centre is a pedestrian zone.

zone.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: if an area of land is zoned, it is officially kept to be used for a particular purpose
zone.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The land is currently zoned for residential use.
zone.translation[1].definitions[0].note_: Zone is usually passive in this meaning
zone.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a large area that is different from others around it in some way
zone.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: 90% of non-smokers want smoke-free zones at work and in public places.
zone.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: a group of countries where you do not need a licence to import goods, you do not need special documents to travel etc
zone.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: an area of a city that is used for a particular purpose or activity, such as houses or shops
zone.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: The trucks are limited by federal law to the commercial zone.
The company’s five factories are situated in a new industrial zone outside the city.
zone.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to divide a town or city into different areas for different purposes
zone.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: The privately owned land is currently zoned for residential use  (=for houses) .
